name: Buffalo Chicken Dipping Balls
author: PRINCESSCOOK1
summary: They have the flavor of Buffalo chicken dip rolled into a ball and then breaded and deep fried. Dip in either ranch or blue cheese dip. I served these at a Super Bowl party, and the crowd loved them.
ingredients: 2 (12.5 fl oz) cans chunk chicken breast, drained and flaked
1 cup hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's RedHot®)
directions: Mix the chicken, green onions, Cheddar cheese, pepperjack cheese, hot sauce, and ranch dressing mix together in a bowl; form the mixture into 1-inch balls with a scoop
Place the balls on a large, flat dish; chill in refrigerator 2 to 3 hours
Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Gently press the balls into the flour to coat and shake off any excess
Dip into the beaten egg and then press into bread crumbs
Place the breaded chicken balls onto a plate while breading the rest; do not stack
Fry the breaded balls in the hot oil until slightly browned, about 1 minute
